alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 3:10AM MST until December 29 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations for the mountains of 1 to 2 feet with locally up to 3 feet in the upper Cottonwood Canyons. Total snow accumulations for southwest Wyoming of 3 to 7 inches are expected, with winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In Utah, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 and Western Uinta Mountains. In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. * WHEN...From 9 AM Tuesday to 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...The snow will result in travel difficulties for higher elevation routes. Areas of blowing snow are also possible, primarily this afternoon. Use caution when traveling.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511. For winter road conditions from the Wyoming Department of Transportation, visit http://www.wyoroad.info or dial 511.
